connection.
It will simplify matters for the reader if I explain first my own beliefs in the
matter. Consider first the more accurate form of the question. I believe that in
about fifty years’ time it will be possible to program computers, with a storage
capacity of about 109, to make them play the imitation game so well that an av-
erage interrogator will not have more than 70 per cent chance of making the
right identification after five minutes of questionin
